revisionDesc.change: Silent Proofreading Correctios and Miller date note
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Proofreading corrections; add notes on Ulysses S. Grant, reduction of Treasury Clerical Force, Jeff's letter, letter date, gift boxes, Mrs. Steers
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p:
i have just received your letter i was very glad to hear from you it seemed quite long since i had a letter i am glad you have got rid of your cold it has stuck too you pretty long i was glad to get the letter and glad to have what it contained to tell the thruth truth Edd and i have had to live pretty saving when georgeGeorge went away
he dident didn't leave me any and i hadent hadn't very much and i had the washing to pay for out off it so i told eddEdd last night he should have bread and coffee to day but i gess guess we shant shan't starve every thing is so dear butter 65 cents per lb i dont don't get much of it meat is cheaper and i like it better i dont don't know whether georgGeorge will come home this week or not he thought he would when he went away if he could leave) i am pretty well only last sunday Sunday morning i hurt my knee i catched caught my foot and struck my knee and it got so lame in the coarse course of the day i could hardly walk it is a little better at present but is very stiff i thought i was glad georgeGeorge was gone for i couldent couldn't hardly doo do any thing when i was entirely still it dident didn't hurt me much but i tryed tried
to walk and it hurt me so i had to sit still but i think it will be better soon i have been trying to get things straighenedstraightened up a little prepatory to moving when my knee was so lame i thought what would i doo do if i was so i couldent couldn't walk but i can walk quite smart to day if i keep my knee strait straight it hurts me so to bend it) i suppose we shall have to go as soon as the house is in any kind of condition if georgeGeorge comes home i shall get him to have one of the stoves put up to get the wall perfectly dry i dont don't regret leaving this house when the cellar is open i can smell the dampness up stairs if the door is open they have every kind of stuff down there and the rats has dug so the water comes in every rain i told mrsMrs. steers they ought to open the doors every clear day but she is very much engaged making money to think of any thing she is clever to me but they want the rooms i suppose its it's natural enoughf enough i have the music marm and the daughter to practice and all) i have had no corresspondence correspondence at all only your s dear Walt so i havent haven't heard from any body only as you say you have had a letter from jeffJeff i should think as mattyMatty is so smart they would keep house) you remember Walt i always said if Grant got to be presedent president i hoped he wouldent wouldn't disappoint his party but i dont don't know i hope he wont won't but i suppose time will tell)

postscript.p: i felt sorry to see so many females discharged
